text: Hello everyone, Is it possible to make HubSpot theme with React? The documentation only talks about js frameworks for modules but not for themes .... Thanks ! :slightly_smiling_face:

Yes it’s possible, though we don’t have any examples of a full theme built this way.

There are limitations for example routing right now.

That said I recommend reviewing this page:
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/guides/js-frameworks>

It should give you a bit of an idea of what considerations you have to make.

You would still need HubL to pass some data to your react app. Some useful patterns for that can be found in the React boilerplate module example.
Hi Jon, thank you very much, but I have seen this documentation before, conclusion for me HubSpot does not support the React model except for modules. And this is quite normal for a CMS of this kind

Yes, I don’t think there’s a way for routing to work with HubSpot CMS (that I’ve found yet) but our team did just successfully complete a full theme using React, structured as each module having its own React root.  So it doesn’t benefit from the routing, but does have all the other benefits of coding in react, and maintains the flexible HubSpot page building that our content team loves so much.
